p: In order to acquire the optimal Mn doping concentration, the emission peak and FWHM variation are analyzed and shown in Fig. 4. It can be seen from Fig. 4a that the PL intensity increases as the concentration of Mn 2+ is increased from 3.04 to 6.45 mg/mL. Further increasing the Mn 2+ concentration makes the PL intensity decrease, which is due to the self-Abs effect at high concentration. During the whole process, the PL peak position and the FWHM remains the same. In other words, the change of Mn 2+ concentration has no effect on the PL emission peak and FWHM, which are also verified by the color coordinates chart (Fig. 4b). No matter how the concentration changes, the color coordinates are basically maintained at (0.535, 0.460) (the black dots). Therefore, the concentration of 6.45 mg/mL is taken as the optimal concentration.
